resources.string:
"This app is for Mobile & Ubiquitous Computing Assignment 3. You can use this app to check the hygiene ratings for restaurants around the UK.
Features: - Supports all features asked by the assignment. - Information is shown in a listview initially, then a mapview in the second tab. - Toggleable filtering options on the top right corner of listview: a. List is filterable by typing in the search bar. Resets on X. b. List is sortable by clicking the sort icon, choose the options, then click the arrow to sort. - Each page has 30 items and page navigation buttons at the bottom of list. Please use this. This design sacrifices the ability to obtain all results for speed and storage. - MapMarkers window clickable, leading to specific establishment details page. - Go to simple search by clicking top right search icon. - Go to local search by opening app, or NEAR MY CURRENT LOCATION button in simple search. - Go to advance search by clicking button at bottom of simple search activity.
Design: - Intended to be intuitive and aesthetically pleasing. - App is highly robust and dynamic.
Additional Features: - Also supports location permissions behaviors when used by android 6.0+. - Responsive depending on whether device location is on or off. Evident on app launch: a. If location permission is granted, then search by nearest location. b. If not then go to simple search. (Reason? The most probable reason for opening this app is to check the hygiene of restaurants you are about to visit.) - Able to share business detail. - Attempt to be efficient with singleton RequestQueue and GSON classes. - MapMarkers are color coded according to its business types: GREEN : Restaurants & Takeaways & Pub/Bar MAGENTA : Distributors ORANGE : Farmers ROSE : Hospitals AZURE : Hotels VIOLET : Manufactures & Import/Export YELLOW : Mobile Catering & Other Catering CYAN : Retailers - Supermarket & Retailers - Other BLUE : Schools and University RED : ERROR
Sources: - Uses GSON from Google, to parse JSON. - Maps features borrowed from Google. - Uses the FSA API and its official images.
